subject: Doping (Sports)
Tests and Testing
Soccer
Steroids
lead_paragraph: FIFA, in agreement with the World Anti-Doping Agency, set out plans for drug-testing top-level players in 2009. The new antidoping rules begin Friday as a pilot project created after FIFA objected to players being held to the toughest standards of the new WADA code, which governs all other sports. FIFA called it a “football-specific approach to an effective and efficient antidoping program.”.
